00044    template <typename Data>
00045    class ArraySet : public PArray<Data>
00046    { 
00047 
00048       using PArray<Data>::ptrs_;
00049       using PArray<Data>::capacity_;
00050       using PArray<Data>::size_;

00182    /* 
00183    * Default constructor.
00184    */
00185    template <typename Data>
00186    ArraySet<Data>::ArraySet()
00187     : data_(0),    
00188       tags_(0)
00189    {}

00191    /* 
00192    * Destructor.
00193    */
00194    template <typename Data>
00195    ArraySet<Data>::~ArraySet()
00196    {
00197       if (ptrs_ != 0) {
00198          delete [] ptrs_; 
00199       }
00200       if (tags_ != 0) {
00201          delete [] tags_;
00202       }
00203    }

00205    /* 
00206    * Create an association with a C array, and allocate required memory.
00207    */
00208    template <typename Data>
00209    void ArraySet<Data>::allocate(const Data* array, int capacity) 
00210    {
00211 
00212       // Preconditions
00213       if (ptrs_ != 0)    UTIL_THROW("Can only be allocated once");
00214       if (capacity == 0) UTIL_THROW("Zero capacity");
00215       if (capacity < 0)  UTIL_THROW("Negative capacity");
00216 
00217       data_     = array;
00218       capacity_ = capacity;
00219 
00220       ptrs_     = new Data*[capacity_];
00221       tags_     = new int[capacity_];
00222 
00223       size_     = 0;
00224       for (int i = 0; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00225          ptrs_[i] =  0;
00226          tags_[i] = -1;
00227       }
00228 
00229    }
00230 
00231    /* 
00232    * Create association with an Array, and allocate required memory.
00233    */
00234    template <typename Data>
00235    void ArraySet<Data>::allocate(const Array<Data>& array) 
00236    {  allocate(&array[0], array.capacity()); }
00237 
00238    /*
00239    * Append an element to the set.
00240    */
00241    template <typename Data>
00242    void ArraySet<Data>::append(Data& data)
00243    {
00244       Data* const ptr = &data;
00245 
00246       // Check preconditions
00247       if (ptr < data_ || ptr >= data_ + capacity_) {
00248          UTIL_THROW("Pointer out of range");
00249       }
00250       int arrayId = id(ptr);
00251       int setId   = tags_[arrayId];
00252       if (setId >= 0) {
00253          UTIL_THROW("Attempt to add element that is already in set");
00254       }
00255 
00256       // Add to top of set
00257       ptrs_[size_]   = ptr;
00258       tags_[id(ptr)] = size_;
00259       ++size_;
00260    }
00261 
00262    /*
00263    * Remove a specific element from the set.
00264    */
00265    template <typename Data>
00266    void ArraySet<Data>::remove(const Data& data)
00267    {
00268       const Data* const ptr = &data;
00269 
00270       // Preconditions
00271       if (ptr < data_ || ptr >= data_ + capacity_) {
00272          UTIL_THROW("Pointer out of range");
00273       }
00274       int arrayId = id(ptr);
00275       int setId   = tags_[arrayId];
00276       if (setId < 0) {
00277          UTIL_THROW("Element is not in set");
00278       }
00279 
00280       // Debug mode preconditions
00281       assert(setId < capacity_);
00282       assert(ptrs_[setId] == ptr);
00283 
00284       // Remove from set 
00285       tags_[arrayId] = -1;
00286       if (setId != size_ - 1) {
00287          ptrs_[setId] = ptrs_[size_-1];
00288          tags_[id(ptrs_[setId])] = setId;
00289       }
00290       ptrs_[size_-1] = 0;
00291       --size_;
00292 
00293    }
00294 
00295    /*
00296    * Remove the topmost element from the set.
00297    */
00298    template <typename Data>
00299    Data& ArraySet<Data>::pop()
00300    {
00301       // Precondition
00302       if (size_ == 0) {
00303          UTIL_THROW("Attempt to pop from empty ArraySet");
00304       }
00305 
00306       Data* ptr = ptrs_[size_ - 1];
00307       tags_[id(ptr)] = -1;
00308       ptrs_[size_-1] =  0;
00309       --size_;
00310       return *ptr;
00311    }
00312 
00313    /*
00314    * Reset to empty state.
00315    */
00316    template <typename Data>
00317    void ArraySet<Data>::clear() 
00318    { 
00319       assert(ptrs_ != 0);
00320       assert(tags_ != 0);
00321       size_ = 0;
00322       for (int i = 0; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00323          ptrs_[i] =  0;
00324          tags_[i] = -1;
00325       }
00326    }
00327 
00332    template <typename Data>
00333    int ArraySet<Data>::index(const Data& data) const
00334    {
00335       const Data* const ptr = &data;
00336       if (ptr < data_ || ptr >= data_ + capacity_) {
00337          UTIL_THROW("Pointer out of range");
00338       }
00339       return tags_[id(ptr)];
00340    }

00343    template <typename Data>
00344    void ArraySet<Data>::dump() const
00345    {
00346       for (int i=0; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00347          Log::file() << i << "  ";
00348          if (ptrs_[i] != 0 ) {
00349             Log::file() << id(ptrs_[i]);
00350          } else {
00351             Log::file() << "N";
00352          }
00353          Log::file() << "  " ;
00354          if (tags_[i] >= 0 ) {
00355             Log::file() << tags_[i];
00356          } else {
00357             Log::file() << "N";
00358          }
00359          Log::file() << std::endl;
00360       }
00361       Log::file() << std::endl << std::endl;
00362    }

00364 
00365    template <typename Data>
00366    inline bool ArraySet<Data>::isAllocated() const
00367    { return ptrs_ != 0; }
00368 
00369    /* 
00370    * Return true if valid, or throw an exception.
00371    */
00372    template <typename Data>
00373    bool ArraySet<Data>::isValid() const
00374    {
00375       int i, j, size;
00376 
00377       if (ptrs_ != 0) {
00378          if (tags_ == 0) {
00379             UTIL_THROW("ptrs_ is allocated but tags_ is not");
00380          }
00381 
00382          // Loop over tags_
00383          size = 0;
00384          for (i = 0; i < capacity_ ; ++i) {
00385             j = tags_[i];
00386             if (j >= 0) {
00387                if (j >= capacity_) {
00388                   UTIL_THROW("tags_[i] > capacity_");
00389                }
00390                if (id(ptrs_[j]) != i) {
00391                   UTIL_THROW("Inconsistent tags and ptrs: 1");
00392                }
00393                ++size;
00394             }
00395          }
00396          if (size != size_) {
00397             UTIL_THROW("Number of nonnegative tags != size");
00398          }
00399 
00400          // Loop over ptrs in set
00401          size = 0;
00402          for (i = 0; i < size_ ; ++i) {
00403             if (ptrs_[i] !=0) {
00404                j = id(ptrs_[i]);
00405                if (tags_[j] != i) {
00406                   UTIL_THROW("Inconsistent tags and ptrs: 2");
00407                }
00408                ++size;
00409             } else {
00410                UTIL_THROW("Null pointer ptrs_[i] for i < size_");
00411             }
00412          }
00413          if (size != size_) {
00414             UTIL_THROW("Number of non-Null pointers != size");
00415          }
00416 
00417          // Check empty elements of ptrs_ array
00418          for (i = size_; i < capacity_ ; ++i) {
00419             if (ptrs_[i] != 0) {
00420                UTIL_THROW("Non-null pointer ptrs_[i] for i >= size_");
00421             }
00422          }
00423 
00424       } else {
00425          if (tags_ != 0) {
00426             UTIL_THROW("ptrs_ == 0, but tags_ != 0");
00427          }
00428          if (capacity_ != 0) {
00429             UTIL_THROW("ptrs_ == 0, but capacity_ != 0");
00430          }
00431          if (size_ != 0) {
00432             UTIL_THROW("ptrs_ == 0, but size_ != 0");
00433          }
00434       }
00435       return true;
00436    }
00437 
00438    // Private inline function
00439 
00440    template <typename Data>
00441    inline int ArraySet<Data>::id(const Data *ptr) const
00442    {  return int(ptr - data_); }
